page.title: 07Pirton Church .
page.content: Pirton Church is known as St. Peters Church. St. Peter was crucified up side down and there is an up side down carving of St. Peter on the archway inside the church. The archway is norman. In the eighteenth Century the bell tower fell down. When the builders were repairing it a little stone fell down and people thought it was a token the pilgrims took to canterbury.There are three bells in Pirton Church. The walls are 1m thick for protection. The first baptism was on February seventh 1813, it was a little girl called Lucy. On April eighth 1866 a little boy called William, who lived at{Hermatige farm,} was christened. We found this out from the records which are still kept inside the church.
